headline.main: MEXICO.; Settlement of the Tehuantepec Question--The Leader of the San Vicente Murders Captured--Politics--Messrs. Benjamin and Soule in Mexico--The Yucatan Revolutions-Large Cargoes of Treasure.

docs.lead_paragraph: Advices front Vera Cruz are received to the 7th inst. The correspondent of the Picayune, writing on that day, says: I "By express,just arrived in thirty-six hours from the capital, we learn that the Tehuantepec negotiators have been successfull-an arrangement having been signed day before yesterday, granting all or nearly all asked for by them.
docs.abstract: The Sloo and Garay grants annulled

headline.main: LOSS OF THE CENTRAL AMERICA; Additional Names of the Supposed Lost CONDITION OF THE SURVIVORS Charges Against Ashby, the Engineer...His Defence. LIST OF THE SAVED. Thrilling Narratives by the Survivors. Arrival of the Empire City with Ninety-Two of the Rescued Passengers. One Hundred and Twenty-Four Known to be Saved. Lights Seen During the Night Near Where the Ship Went Down. HOPES OF THE SAFETY OF OTHERS

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival at this port yesterday morning of The United States Mail steamship Empire City, Capt. McGOWAN, from Norfolk, on the 18th inst., bringing eighty-three of the rescued passengers and crew of the unfortunate Central America, we are placed in possession of many additional and important facts relative to the fearful catastrophe, which has brought desolation to so many hearths, and filled so many hearts with woe.

headline.main: THE CALIFORNIA MAILS.; CALIFORNIA. News from California, Central America, New-Granada and the South Pacific.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nominations of the Settlers' Convention--Indian Depredations-Overland Immigration-Mining and Agricultural Intelligence, We obtain by way of New-Orleans California intelligence for the fortnight ending Aug. 20. They are the same advices as those which left Aspinwall in the ill-fated steamship Central America.

headline.main: Brain and Muscle Market.; JOURNEYMEN SHOEMAKERS.

headline.main: THE METROPOLITAN POLICE.; First Quarterly Report of the General Superintendent.

docs.lead_paragraph: General Superintendent TALLMADGE sent in the following (his first) quarterly report to the Police Board: OFFICER SUPERINTENDENT METROPOLITAN POLICE, No. 88 White-street, New-York, Sept. 3, 1857. To THE PRESIDENT ON THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE METROPOLITAN POLICE DISTRICT--Sir: In compliance with the provisions of the act of the Legislatue entitled "An act to establish a Metropolitan

headline.main: QUARANTINE REMOVAL.; Official Documents--Majority and Minority Report of the Commissioners--Answer of Governor King--Another Effort to be Made to Procure Sandy Hook.

docs.lead_paragraph: The public anxiety to know what turn affairs would take in the matter of-the proposed removal of the Quarantine station, will be relieved to a great extent, by the perusal of the following official documents. They consist of a report from Messrs. HALL and BOWNE, a minority report from Mr. BENSON, and the answer and recommendation of the Governor, Lieutenant-Governor, and Comptroller, upon the whole subject.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; Approaching Launch of the Great Eastern. Cotton Firm--Breadstuffs Unchanged-Consols 90 3-8. LORD ELGIN' POLICY IN CHINA. THE AMERICAN HORSE LECOMTE BEATEN. THE ATLANTIC TELEGRAPH ENTERPRISE, ARRIVAL OF THE PERSIA. Further Details of the Indian Massacres at Cawnpore.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship Persia, Capt. JUDKINS, which left Liverpool at about 10 o'clock on the morning of Saturday, the 5th inst., arrived at this port yesterday morning. The steamship Fulton arrived off Cowes on the morning of Sept. 3. The steamship Antelope appointed to leave Liverpool for St. Johns, Newfoundland, on the 7th, instead of the 5th, as advertised.

headline.main: American State Convention at Syracuse.; SPIRITED PROCEEDINGS. Debate as to the Propriety of a New Platform. President took his seat, amidst load ?? A HARMONIOUS ORGANIZATION. The Resolutions Confined to Matters of State Policy. Debate as to the Propriety of a New Platform. NOMINATIONS FOR STATE OFFICERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The American State Convention was called to order at 12 o'clock by JESSE C. DANN, President of the American State Council, in Voorhies Hall. He said: GENTLEMEN: It is my duty to preside over your deliberations until this body is organized, and in so doing I beg the kind indulgence of the Convention.
